alert.note: Alert for Essex; King William; King and Queen; Richmond (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 2:26PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Virginia, including the following counties, Essex, King William, King and Queen and Richmond. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... King William, Tappahannock, Warsaw, Millers Tavern, Stevensville, Dunnsville, Center Cross, Crouch, Howertons, Bruington, Upright, Ino, Brays Fork, Henley Fork, Bowlers Wharf, Walkerton, Rose Garden, Wellford, Kennard and Lanesville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Essex; King William; King and Queen; Richmond
